protocol_name: Isolation and Purification of Plasmid DNA from E. coli
protocol_name_html: Isolation and Purification of Plasmid DNA from E. coli
guidelines:
MATERIALS:

 

         1)      E. coli, strain ____, containing plasmid

         2)      LB media

                           1.0% Bacto-tryptone

                           0.5% Bacto-yeast extract

                           1.0% NaCl

                           Add the appropriate antibiotic to the growth media for the plasmid to be purified.

         3)      Chloramphenicol, 34 mg/mL, made up in 100% EtOH, filter sterilized.

         4)      Spectinomycin, 10 mg/mL, made up in d-H2O, filter sterilized.

         5)      Lysozyme solution

                           25 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0

                           10 mM EDTA

                           50 mM Glucose

                           Add lysozyme to a concentration of 2 mg/mL just before use.

         6)      Alkaline SDS solution

                           0.2 M NaOH

                           1.0% SDS

                           Make up fresh from stock solutions for each use.

         7)      High salt solution, per 100 mL

                           60.0 mL of 5 M KOAc

                           11.5 mL of glacial acetic acid

                           28.5 mL of d-H2O

         8)      50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 100 mM NaOAc

         9)      10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA (1X TE buffer)

         10)    Ethidium bromide, 10 mg/mL in d-H2O

         11)    CsCl, solid

         12)    100% EtOH

         13)    Isopropanol, CsCl/TE buffer saturated

         14)    3 M NaOAc

         15)    Beckman Ti50 rotor quick seal tubes

         16)    Syringes, with 18g needles

         17)    Phenol, buffer-saturated

References

  • C. Birnboim. A rapid Alkaline Extraction Method for the Isolation of Plasmid DNA.

         Methods In Enzymology 100:  243-255.

 

  • Maniatis, E.F. Fritsch, and J. Sambrook. Large-scale Isolation of Plasmid DNA.

         Molecular Cloning:  A Laboratory Manual.  Pages 86- 94.

components.data: Inoculate 1000 mL of L broth containing the appropriate antibiotic with 10 mL of an overnight culture of the E. coli strain containing the plasmid to be purified.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Inoculate 1000 mL of L broth containing the appropriate antibiotic with 10 mL of an overnight culture of the E. coli strain containing the plasmid to be purified.

components.data: Incubate at 37°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C overnight.

components.data: If amplification of the plasmid DNA is necessary (because of low copy  number of the plasmid under normal conditions), after 4-8 hours of growth, add chloramphenicol (34 mg/mL) to a final concentration  of 170 ug/mL or spectinomycin (10 mg/mL) to a final concentration of 50 ug/mL (if the bacteria carries chloramphenicol resistance).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If amplification of the plasmid DNA is necessary (because of low copy  number of the plasmid under normal conditions), after 4-8 hours of growth, add chloramphenicol (34 mg/mL) to a final concentration  of 170 ug/mL or spectinomycin (10 mg/mL) to a final concentration of 50 ug/mL (if the bacteria carries chloramphenicol resistance).

components.data: Incubate at 37°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C overnight.

components.data: Centrifuge the bacterial cells in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 5,000 rpm, 5 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the bacterial cells in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 5,000 rpm, 5 min, 4°C.

components.data: Use 3-250 mL GSA bottles per liter of bacteria.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use 3-250 mL GSA bottles per liter of bacteria.

components.data: Discard the supernatants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatants.

components.data: Resuspend the cells with 60 mL (total, 20 mL/bottle) of lysozyme solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the cells with 60 mL (total, 20 mL/bottle) of lysozyme solution.

components.data: Incubate on ice for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate on ice for 30 min.

components.data: Add 120 mL (total, 40 mL/bottle) of the alkaline SDS solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 120 mL (total, 40 mL/bottle) of the alkaline SDS solution.

components.data: Gently mix (by inversion) until the solution clears.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently mix (by inversion) until the solution clears.

components.data: Incubate on ice for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate on ice for 5 min.

components.data: Add 90 mL (total, 30 mL/bottle) of the high salt solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 90 mL (total, 30 mL/bottle) of the high salt solution.

components.data: Mix well and incubate on ice for 30-60 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well and incubate on ice for 30-60 min.

components.data: Centrifuge the bottles in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the bottles in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.

components.data: Decant the supernatants to clean bottles.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Decant the supernatants to clean bottles.

components.data: Precipitate the DNA with 2X volumes (approximately 170-180 mL) of 100% EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate the DNA with 2X volumes (approximately 170-180 mL) of 100% EtOH.

components.data: Hold at -80°C for 60 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hold at -80°C for 60 min.

components.data: Centrifuge the bottles in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the bottles in the Sorvall GSA rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.

components.data: Discard the supernatants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatants.

components.data: Resuspend the pellets with 10 mL each of 50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 100 mM NaOAc.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the pellets with 10 mL each of 50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 100 mM NaOAc.

components.data: Transfer the material to 30 mL corex tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the material to 30 mL corex tubes.

components.data: Add an equal volume of buffer-saturated phenol to each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of buffer-saturated phenol to each tube.

components.data: Mix well and centrifuge in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well and centrifuge in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, room temperature.

components.data: Remove the upper aqueous layers to clean 30 mL corex tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the upper aqueous layers to clean 30 mL corex tubes.

components.data: Precipitate the DNAs with 2X volumes of 100% EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate the DNAs with 2X volumes of 100% EtOH.

components.data: Hold at -80°C for 45 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hold at -80°C for 45 min.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall HB-4 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall HB-4 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.

components.data: Discard the supernatants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatants.

components.data: Dry the pellets briefly (10-15 min) in the vacuum  desiccator to remove the EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry the pellets briefly (10-15 min) in the vacuum  desiccator to remove the EtOH.

components.data: Resuspend each plasmid DNA with a total of 10 mL of 1X TE buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend each plasmid DNA with a total of 10 mL of 1X TE buffer.

components.data: Weigh out exactly 6.8 gm of CsCl into each of 2-30 mL corex tubes for each plasmid DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Weigh out exactly 6.8 gm of CsCl into each of 2-30 mL corex tubes for each plasmid DNA.

components.data: Divide each plasmid DNA solution between the 2 tubes of CsCl, measuring the volume.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Divide each plasmid DNA solution between the 2 tubes of CsCl, measuring the volume.

components.data: Add 1X TE buffer to the tubes of CsCl to a final volume of 6.4 mL added to each  tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1X TE buffer to the tubes of CsCl to a final volume of 6.4 mL added to each  tube.

components.data: Mix well, until all the CsCl is in solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well, until all the CsCl is in solution.

components.data: Add 512 µL of ethidium bromide (10 mg/mL) to each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 512 µL of ethidium bromide (10 mg/mL) to each tube.

components.data: Mix well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 15 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 15 min, 4°C.

components.data: Transfer the supernatants to Beckman polyallomar Ti50 rotor quick-seal tubes using a syringe and needle (18g).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the supernatants to Beckman polyallomar Ti50 rotor quick-seal tubes using a syringe and needle (18g).

components.data: Fill the tubes to capacity with  a CsCl/ethidium bromide solution (6.8 gm CsCl, 6.4 mL 1X TE buffer, 512 µL 10 mg/ml ethidium bromide).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Fill the tubes to capacity with  a CsCl/ethidium bromide solution (6.8 gm CsCl, 6.4 mL 1X TE buffer, 512 µL 10 mg/ml ethidium bromide).

components.data: Seal the tubes with the Beckman tube sealer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Seal the tubes with the Beckman tube sealer.

components.data: Centrifuge the gradients in the Beckamn Ti50 rotor at 35,000 rpm, 72 hours, 25°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the gradients in the Beckamn Ti50 rotor at 35,000 rpm, 72 hours, 25°C.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 42 of Isolation and Purification of Plasmid DNA from E. coli
source_data.protocol_name: Isolation and Purification of Plasmid DNA from E. coli
source_data.protocol_name_html: Isolation and Purification of Plasmid DNA from E. coli
source_data.annotation: Alternatively, centrifuge in the Beckman Ti70.1 rotor at 45,000 rpm, 24-40 hours, 25°C.
source_data.thread_text: Alternatively, centrifuge in the Beckman Ti70.1 rotor at 45,000 rpm, 24-40 hours, 25°C.
source_data.body: Alternatively, centrifuge in the Beckman Ti70.1 rotor at 45,000 rpm, 24-40 hours, 25°C.

components.data: Visualize the DNA using a UV light source.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Visualize the DNA using a UV light source.

components.data: Remove the plasmid DNA from the gradients by puncturing the side of the tube with an 18g needle and syringe.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the plasmid DNA from the gradients by puncturing the side of the tube with an 18g needle and syringe.

components.data: Place a small amount of Vaseline on the side of the tube and puncture through the Vaseline.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place a small amount of Vaseline on the side of the tube and puncture through the Vaseline.

components.data: Smear the Vaseline over the puncture hole when the syringe is removed to seal the hole.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Smear the Vaseline over the puncture hole when the syringe is removed to seal the hole.

components.data: Circular plasmid DNA is the lower band in the gradient.  Chromosomal DNA and nicked circular DNA is in the upper band in the gradient.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Circular plasmid DNA is the lower band in the gradient.  Chromosomal DNA and nicked circular DNA is in the upper band in the gradient.

components.data: Place the DNA solution into 30 mL corex tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the DNA solution into 30 mL corex tubes.

components.data: Extract the ethidium bromide from the DNA solution by adding an equal  volume of CsCl/TE buffer saturated isopropanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract the ethidium bromide from the DNA solution by adding an equal  volume of CsCl/TE buffer saturated isopropanol.

components.data: Mix gently and centrifuge in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 3,000 rpm, 1 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix gently and centrifuge in the Sorvall SS34 rotor at 3,000 rpm, 1 min, 4°C.

components.data: Pipet off the upper isopropanol layer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet off the upper isopropanol layer.

components.data: Repeat the isopropanol extraction 1X.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat the isopropanol extraction 1X.

components.data: Add 1.0 mL of 3 M NaOAc to each tube of DNA and adjust the volume in each tube to 10.0 mL with 1X TE buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1.0 mL of 3 M NaOAc to each tube of DNA and adjust the volume in each tube to 10.0 mL with 1X TE buffer.

components.data: Precipitate the DNAs with 2X volumes of 100% EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Precipitate the DNAs with 2X volumes of 100% EtOH.

components.data: Hold at -20°C overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hold at -20°C overnight.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall HB-4 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes in the Sorvall HB-4 rotor at 10,000 rpm, 10 min, 4°C.

components.data: Discard the supernatants.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the supernatants.

components.data: Dry the pellets briefly (10-15 min) in the vacuum desiccator to remove the EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry the pellets briefly (10-15 min) in the vacuum desiccator to remove the EtOH.

components.data: Resuspend the plasmid DNAs with 1X TE buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend the plasmid DNAs with 1X TE buffer.

components.data: Determine the DNA concentration.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Determine the DNA concentration.

components.data: Store the DNAs at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store the DNAs at 4°C.
